title: Audio | Review: Practicing Affirmation by Sam Crabtree
description:
An audio recording of my review of Practicing Affirmation by Sam Crabtree. 

See the review here: https://www.coltonkirby.com/post/review-practicing-affirmation

Make sure to like and subscribe!

Check out my podcast: Fining Ideas | The Colton Kirby Show: https://anchor.fm/coltonkirby

transcript_parts.text: review practicing affirmation by sam
crabtree this book lays out a christian
understanding of how to produce positive
emotions and positive exchanges between
individuals
affirmation is the act of commending
someone for something that they have
specifically done well
crabtree begins the book by asserting
that affirmation of people is not the
same as god-like praise of another
he then goes on to show what affirmation
really is and how it is practiced
people he says need a healthy amount of
affirmation balanced with correction
this would supposedly be the cupid arrow
spectrum but only with regards to
affirmation
the best way that crabtree put the
proportion
for affirmation to correction was with a
piece of land
the soil needs to be wet but if too wet
it will drown the plants
the soil is a person in sunlight is
correction while affirmation is water
keep it wet but not drowning the rest of
the book is
in my opinion basically a series of
footnotes the first three chapters
i would give the first three chapters a
rating of 80 out of a hundred
i would give the whole book subtracting
the last chapter a 73 out of a hundred
however with the last chapter the book
as i rate it
is a 61 out of 100. why
you may ask does the rating decreased
first off the whole book was set in the
first three chapters
so the additional ones are just
basically restating the case using
different wording
this extra content results in at least
for myself
little to no extra knowledge moreover
the last chapter was a vastly incredible
oversimplification of the entire rest of
the book
so simple in some cases that it undercut
other important things
crabtree had earlier remarked the last
chapter
was a list of 100 ways to be affirming
vagueness though repudiated in all
other chapters of the book is implicitly
if not explicitly promoted in the last
go read for yourself these disastrous
things and tell me how
these are fine to do the suggested tips
mentioned in the last chapter
which follow are strange and undermine
with the some of the books said
two theological disagreements emerge in
my mind regarding the book
was the first was that if you affirm
people god will bless you
this was first presented in chapter two
and in chapter five
perhaps he tried to explain away this
theologically arrowed idea
we do nothing besides believing god to
be blessed anything else is workspace
theology
the second was that he said quote if
anyone does anything that pleases god it
happens because god is already at work
in that person
this is basically saying that if you do
something that god likes
it is because god is having you do it
what foolishness
where is free will i bring up these two
examples not to argue against them here
but just to let the reader be aware of
them and to remind myself that they are
presented in this work
to sum it up read this book but the
whole book is in
the first three chapter
